bug.author: jiayilee97
bug.summary: Error when making source code on Ubuntu 16.04
bug.description:
i followed these instructions (for linux x86): <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Tencent/ncnn/wiki/how-to-build>https://github.com/Tencent/ncnn/wiki/how-to-build</denchmark-link>
when i tried to build the NCNN using sudo make -j4, i got these errors <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34804280/75039512-cf4df400-54f3-11ea-8fa6-a129977908a2.png></denchmark-link>
The errors are very similar to this: /ncnn/tools/quantize/ncnn2table.cpp:820:26: error: passing ‚Äòconst cv::CommandLineParser‚Äô as ‚Äòthis‚Äô argument discards qualifiers [-fpermissive] im using g++-5, gcc5 and opencv 2.4

comments.comment:
fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Tencent/ncnn/commit/c089ddb3c235033f8da52b5d22639df5b0ff0824>c089ddb</denchmark-link>
please update the ncnn git code and try again :)

hmmm, the opencv api compatibility issue is not so easy to fix For now, you can comment the quantize directory if you aren't eager to use the quantization tools.
ncnn/tools/CMakeLists.txt
Line 6 in c089ddb
add_subdirectory(quantize)
I have the same issue. Have you solved the problemÔºü

The default opencv version of Ubuntu 16.04 is too old, using opencv 3.+ could solve the problem. download and compile 3.x+ version of opencv, then setting the env like this: export PATH=xxx/opencv-3.xx/bin:$PATH then... cd build; cmake ../; make -j10 That works for me

The default opencv version of Ubuntu 16.04 is too old, using opencv 3.+ could solve the problem. download and compile 3.x+ version of opencv, then setting the env like this: export PATH=xxx/opencv-3.xx/bin:$PATH then... cd build; cmake ../; make -j10 That works for me
